full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 609 Filed 02/24/22 Page 2 of 13

Table of Contents

I. PRELIMINARY STATEMENT .................................................... 4
II. FACTUAL BACKGROUND ....................................................... 5
III. ARGUMENT ................................................................... 6
    A. Juror 50's Request to Intervene ............................................... 7
        1. Jurors have compelling and legitimate privacy rights ....................... 7
        2. Jurors may face criminal exposure for answers given on jury questionnaires .... 8
        3. Intervention in criminal trials may be granted to protect the rights of third parties ............................................................... 8
    B. Juror 50's Jury Questionnaire should be released to Counsel but otherwise remain under seal, to provide Juror 50 with a full and fair opportunity to present his position to this Court ....................................... 9
        1. A copy of the Jury Questionnaire is necessary to comply with Judge Nathan's January 5th order ............................................... 9
        2. The Court has the authority to release the Jury Questionnaire under seal ...... 10
        3. The instance matter presents a compelling reason to release the Jury Questionnaire to Counsel, under seal ....................................... 11
IV. CONCLUSION ................................................................. 11

2

DOJ-OGR-00008981
